definitions.definition: The state of being precise or exact ; especially, both exact and accurate .
The ability of a measurement to be reproduced consistently .
examples: The classic example of the difference between precision and accuracy is that in target practice, if the grouping is tight but the group is off-center, your precision is good but your accuracy needs calibration.

definitions.definition: The number of significant digits to which a value may be measured reliably .
A bidding system that makes use of many artificial bids to describe a hand quite precisely.

main_definition: ( loosely ) The state of being precise or exact ; especially, both exact and accurate .
secondary_definitions: ( strictly ) The ability of a measurement to be reproduced consistently .
( mathematics ) The number of significant digits to which a value may be measured reliably .
( bridge ) A bidding system that makes use of many artificial bids to describe a hand quite precisely.
